text: Hills Radio 88.9 FM (callsign 5HR) was a community radio station based in Mount Barker, South Australia. Hills Radio commenced broadcasting on a temporary community broadcasting licence on 22 August 2014. Hills Radio claims to have a reliable broadcast radius of 20 km from Mount Barker. Hills Radio's temporary community broadcasting licence expired on 30 June 2020Temporary Community Radio Broadcasting Licences. Retrieved 2020-09-24.. The broadcast licence for the 88.9 FM frequency was reallocated by the Australian Communications and Media Authority after Hills Radio were unsuccessful in their application for a full time license to broadcast. Hills Radio ceased radio transmissions on 30 September 2020 and from 1 October 2020 Hills Radio shifted to streaming its programs online 24 hours per day, 7 days per week.http://wordpress.hillsradio.com.au/ Retrieved 2020-09-24. == Hills Football League broadcasts == From 2015 until the end of the 2017 season, Hills Radio broadcast Hills Football League matches during the football season. The first match broadcast by Hills Radio was the Nairne-Bremer v Kersbrook match in Round 4 (2 May 2015). In 2018, the Hills Football League resumed control of their broadcasting rights and set up a new organisation, HFL Media, to distribute HFL content. Hills Radio ceased broadcasts of Hills Football League matches during the football season. ==References== Category:Community radio stations in Australia
title: Hills Radio
